message_1: Find the limit of the function f(x) = (3x^2 - 1)/(x+1) as x approaches 2.
message_2:
To find the limit of the function f(x) = (3x^2 - 1)/(x+1) as x approaches 2, we can simply substitute the value of x with 2 and evaluate the function.

f(2) = (3(2)^2 - 1)/(2+1)
f(2) = (3(4) - 1)/(3)
f(2) = (12 - 1)/3
f(2) = 11/3

So, the limit of the function f(x) = (3x^2 - 1)/(x+1) as x approaches 2 is 11/3.
